products.name: Similac Soy Isomil Infant Formula For Fussiness & Gas with Iron Powder

extendedInfo.detail: Halal. Gluten free.  No. 1 brand fed in hospitals. No palm olein oil. For fussiness & gas. Brain nourishing - DHA. Eye heath - lutein. Growth & development - vitamin E. Breast milk is recommended. If you choose to use infant formula, the makers of Similac have a formula that's right for your baby. C. Cohnii Oil is a source of DHA, M. Alpina Oil  is a source of ARA. Breast milk is recommended. If you choose to use infant formula, the makers of Similac have a formula that's right for your baby.  0-12 months. Scan for more food information. Call 866-938-9730 for more food information.  Have product-related questions? Call 1-800-515-7677, 8:30 am ÛÒ 5:00 pm, Eastern time, weekdays. www.Similac.com. FeedingExpert from Similac. Help with feeding questions is available at 800-986-8800 FeedingExpert.com. Please consult your babyÛªs doctor before switching formulas.
extendedInfo.ingredients: Corn Syrup Solids (40%), Soy Protein Isolate (15%), High Oleic Safflower Oil (11%), Sugar (10%), Soy Oil (8%), Coconut Oil (8%); Less Than 2% Of: C. Cohnii Oil, M. Alpina Oil, Beta-Carotene, Lutei, Short-Chain Fructooligosaccharides, Calcium Phosphate, Potassium Citrate, Potassium Chloride, Salt, Magnesium Chloride, L-Methionine, Ascorbic Acid, Choline Chloride, Potassium Hydroxide, Taurine, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Ferrous Sulfate, Inositol, Zinc Sulfate, Mixed Tocopherols, L-Carnitine, Niacinamide, D-Alpha-Tocopheryl Acetate, Calcium Pantothenate, Copper Sulfate, Thiamine Hydrochloride, Vitamin A Palmitate, Riboflavin, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Folic Acid, Potassium Iodide, Phylloquinone, Biotin, Sodium Selenate, Vitamin D3, And Vitamin B12.
extendedInfo.directions: Storage: Once mixed, store bottles in refrigerator and feed to baby with in 24 hours. Store unopened or opened container at room temperature; avoid extreme temperatures. Use opened can contents within 1 month.   Use by date on can.  Use as directed by a doctor. Directions for Preparation and Use: Your baby's health depends on carefully following these directions. Proper hygiene, handling and storage are important when preparing infant formula. Failure to follow these directions could result in severe harm. Ask your baby's doctor if you need to use cooled, boiled water for mixing and if you need to boil (sterilize) bottles, nipples and rings before use. 1. Wash your hands, surfaces and utensils. Pour water into clean bottle (see mixing guide). 2. Add 1 unpacked level scoop (8.8 g) to each 2 fl oz of water. Return dry scoop to can. 3. Cap bottle; shake well; attach clean nipple. Once feeding begins, use within 1 hour or discard. Mixing Guide: Measure 2 fl oz water + add 1 scoop (8.8 g) of unpacked level powder using enclosed scoop = 2 fl oz Finished bottle (approx.). Measure 4 fl oz Water + add 2 scoops of unpacked level powder using enclosed scoop = 4 fl oz Finished bottle (approx.). Measure 6 fl oz Water + add 3 scoops of unpacked level powder using enclosed scoop = 6 fl oz Finished bottle (approx.). Measure 8 fl oz Water + add 4 scoops of unpacked level powder using enclosed scoop = 8 fl oz Finished bottle (approx.). Similac 1 Can = 22 Bottles (4 fl oz). When mixed as directed, makes approx 90 fl oz of formula.
extendedInfo.warnings: Contains soy ingredients.Warning: Powdered infant formulas are not sterile and should not be fed to premature infants or infants who might have immune problems unless directed and supervised by your babyÛªs doctor. Never use a microwave to warm formula. Serious burns can result.
